intro: Ageratinastrum polyphyllum, commonly known as the many-leafed blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage is often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Ageratinastrum polyphyllum is also noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
